intro: Lippia glazioviana, commonly known as Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, narrow leaves and small blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antispasmodic properties. Lippia glazioviana is also valued as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and flowering display.
